title: Give a critique in class
details: Must list at least one thing to be improved and one thing that is working
Extra points if it’s very thorough
No limit

title: Give a critique in the #show-n-crit channel
details: Must list at least one thing to be improved and one thing that is working
One critique per student per post
Extra points if it’s very thorough
No limit

title: UX/UI analysis of an app
details: Write at least 300 words on your analysis of the user experience and user interface design in any application or operating system. (If you’re analysing an operating system, 450 word minimum because there’s so much to talk about!)
8 points for OS analysis
Can be earned an unlimited number of times each week
Can be posted to #hd-olympics or sent to the instructor directly over Slack

title: Design for Daily UI
details: Get 10 points for every Daily UI challenge you do (https://www.dailyui.co/)
Can be earned an unlimited number of times each week
Earn 4 extra points for including interactions
Earn 4 extra points for animations
Post your design in #dailyui

title: Make a spontaneous UI design
details: Get 10 points for doing a spontaneous UI design
Earn 4 extra points for including interactions
Earn 4 extra points for animations
Get 2 extra points for each additional screen (screens with only small differences may not be counted)
There are no real restrictions here — just make a UI! It can be a mobile app, desktop app, or a web app for any platform. Or get crazy! Do an Xbox app or an Android Auto app!
Can be earned an unlimited number of times each week, however you can not turn in iterations as individual entries. Final design only.
Go through the UI process and document it for an extra 10 points
User test 2+ people for an extra 10 points. No fellow students or instructional team members can be used for testing. Make sure to record your test and give insights.
Make a case study for 5 extra points
Can be posted to #hd-olympics or sent to the instructor directly over Slack

title: Spontaneous UX Challenge
details: Get 40 points if you do a spontaneous UX project
Must include user research
Make a case study for 8 extra points
Can be posted to #hd-olympics or sent to the instructor directly over Slack

title: Complete a personal project
details: Complete a personal UX/UI project for an application
If it’s a web application, it must be responsive
Points awarded based on complexity of design and complexity of thought process
This should be a well thought out, extensive project like the ones we do for homework
Can be earned an unlimited number of times
Can be posted to #hd-olympics or sent to the instructor directly over Slack

title: Go to the design museum
details: Can be earned once per month per person
Post a picture of you inside the museum in #hd-olympics

title: Work with a real life client
details: Work on a UX or UI project for a real life client
You must use the design process and do user research
Does not include existing clients or clients through an existing full-time job
Can be earned an unlimited number of times
Discuss with the instructor to receive points

title: Brand design
details: Go through the design process to create branding for something or someone
Think about brand statement, voice, style guides, UI style guides, logos, and other materials
Can be earned once per week per person
Can be posted to #hd-olympics or sent to the instructor directly over Slack

title: Graphic design
details: Just design something! Using desktop graphic design applications is important for a UX/UI designer. Get comfortable with the tool of your choice!
Must be at least 4” x 6” or 600px x 600px
Points awarded based on complexity of design and complexity of thought process
2 extra points if you use Sketch, Adobe Photoshop, or Adobe Illustrator
Can be earned an unlimited number of times a week
Can be posted to #hd-olympics or sent to the instructor directly over Slack

title: House study group
details: Minimum 3 people of the same house
5 points for the first three students and 1 point for each additional student
Can be earned an unlimited number of times a week
You must submit a selfie to #hd-olympics with everyone in it and tag each member for it to count
Cannot be done remotely

title: Mixed house study group
details: Minimum 4 students of any house
3 points per person awarded to their house
Can be earned an unlimited number of times a week
You must submit a selfie to #hd-olympics with everyone in it and tag each member for it to count
Cannot be done remotely

title: Remote study group
details: Minimum 3 students of any house
Earn 2 points per house plus 1 points per person awarded to their house
Can be earned an unlimited number of times a week
You must submit a screencap (with everyone’s webcams on) to #hd-olympics and tag each member for it to count

title: Bookstore selfie
details: Take a selfie of you at a bookstore reading a design-related book and give a brief synopsis of what you read
You must read at least one chapter of the book
Can be earned once per student per week
Selfie must be posted on #hd-olympics along with a brief summary of what you learned

title: Design meetup
details: Go to a design meetup!
Can be earned an unlimited number of times each week
3 extra points per person if more than one person goes from the same house
If people from multiple houses go, 20 points per house plus 3 extra points per person
Take a selfie while you’re there and post it to #hd-olympics

title: House pride
details: Wear your house colors to class!
Socks and jeans don’t count — unless they’re really special!
Can be earned once per student per class
House pride will be counted at the beginning of class
1 extra point per house if the instructor forgets!

title: Come to office hours
details: Be in class within 10 minutes of the start of office hours to earn points
Ask a TA a question about class materials or a UX/UI design topic and earn 2 extra points

title: Write a blog post
details: Must be at least 250 words
Can be earned once per week
Earn 10 extra points if you post to Medium or another high-traffic public posting platform
Post a link to your post to #hd-olympics

title: Code a website
details: Design and build something using code written by hand
At least 10 points for using just HTML + CSS
Extra 10 points (minimum) for use of JavaScript
Extra 10 points (minimum) for use of AJAX
7-28 points for each additional page
Additional points are awarded for complexity
You can use frameworks or libraries
For the AJAX requirement, you must use jQuery’s AJAX method to make at least one API call of any type and then do something with the returned data (display it on the screen)
Upload your site to GitHub and host it with GitHub Pages (or an alternative host) and submit the link to #hd-olympics

title: Rebuild the House Points Dashboard
details: Use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery’s AJAX method to rebuild the house points website
Must include some UI ideation and prototyping
Do research (user research or testing) for up to 10 extra points
Additional points are awarded for complexity
You must make a GET request to https://hodo.hannahap.com/public/points to receive all the point information needed and then display it on the page
Additionally, make a GET request to https://hodo.hannahap.com/public/challenges to receive all the challenge information needed and then display it on the page for 9 extra points (minimum)
For the AJAX requirement, you must use jQuery’s AJAX method to make at least one API call of any type and then do something with the returned data (display it on the screen)
Upload your site to GitHub and host it with GitHub Pages (or an alternative host) and submit the link to #hd-olympics

title: Build a website in Webflow
details: Use Webflow to design a website
Must include some UI ideation and prototyping
Do research (user research or testing) for up to 10 extra points
Earn 7 extra points minimum per additional page
Additional points are awarded for complexity
Publish your site and post a link in #hd-olympics

title: Build a website in a website editor other than Webflow
details: Use any website editor (Wix, Squarespace, et cetera) to build a website
Must include some UI ideation and prototyping
Do research (user research or testing) for up to 10 extra points
Earn 6 extra points minimum per additional page
Additional points are awarded for complexity
Publish your site and post a link in #hd-olympics

title: Flash mob
details: It is what it sounds like!
Do a public flash mob with your classmates. Can be to any song so long as it’s not vulgar (needs to be public-appropriate)
Minimum of 3 people
45 points per house that participates plus 5 extra points per person plus two points for all houses for each person who joins who is NOT part of class
10 extra points per additional song, maximum three songs
Must be recorded and posted to #hd-olympics
Cannot be done in class, nor can it disrupt other classes
No, there’s nothing design related about this but I still dare you to do it
